Honestly switching between college and work during the Summer, I'd take work any day. When I'm done with the day I can forget about work and truly relax.

Well I'm hoping to download an image. I figure because the US is around 2600 miles wide and 1500 miles high that the image will be around 2600x1500 pixels. I've found images like that here https://www.reddit.com/r/MapPorn/comments/2ymcit/topographic_hillshade_map_of_the_contiguous/
But there's shading around mountains and hills that means I can't easily get the height data. If you know of any relief maps without shading I could use that!
Yes. Though I'd settle for anything around that scale. Thanks so much for helping me!

Well what I'd like to find is elevation data for every square mile. Because I'm not confidant in my ability to sort through data I figure a high resolution image where pixel value shows elevation could help me.

Thanks for the reply! The only trouble is I can't seem to find a complete US map, it seems to all be split into smaller sections. I'm also a bit incompetent with how to use the website. Do you know where I might find an image?

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for topographical US map without shading
WRITING.TEXT: For a personal project I really want to find a topographic US map that doesn't have any shading. I want a single image with all the data and I'm going to create software that reads the pixel values and gets height data. Does anyone know where I could find a map like this?

WRITING.TITLE: Where to get file containing USA elevation data?
WRITING.TEXT:
For a personal project I'm working on I need to get elevation data for the entire US. I'd really like to have just one file containing elevation for every square mile. Is there anywhere I can get this kind of data and use it for free?
Edit: /u/SwampRabbit gave me a link to the kind of image I was looking for here https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/usgs-small-scale-dataset-100-meter-resolution-elevation-of-the-conterminous-united-states-2012
